intro: Cachrys peucedanoides, commonly known as the common cow parsley, is a biennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white or greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, along roadsides, and in woodland edges. Cachrys peucedanoides is also known for its mild, aromatic scent and has been used historically in traditional medicine.
